greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A009194(i) = A009194(j) and A323901(i) = A323901(j) for all i, j.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A009194(n), A323901(n)].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
Index entries for sequences related to Stern's sequences
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 04 2020
